intro: Ruellia sesamoides, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright perennial, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Ruellia sesamoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
